excerpt: South Beach is known for its beaches and the glamorous scene around its happening nightspots and celebrity-chef eateries. Chain stores and indie fashion shops line pedestrian shopping strip Lincoln Road Mall. On Ocean Drive, known for its well-preserved art deco architecture, outdoor cafes offer a ringside view of the scene. Museums include the Wolfsonian-FIU, which has a collection of modern art and objects.
detail_description: South Beach, located in Miami Beach, is a vibrant and glamorous destination known for its pristine sandy shores, crystal-clear waters, and high-energy atmosphere. The area boasts a bustling nightlife scene with celebrity-chef eateries and happening nightspots. Visitors can explore the well-preserved art deco architecture along Ocean Drive while enjoying outdoor cafes with a view. South Beach offers various activities such as beach volleyball at Lummus Park, shopping at Lincoln Road Mall, and visiting museums like the Wolfsonian-FIU.
name: South Beach
address: Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: 4-acre site with native Floridian & other tropical plants, Japanese garden, workshops & exhibits.
detail_description: Miami Beach Botanical Garden is a 4-acre urban oasis nestled in the heart of South Beach. It features a diverse collection of native Floridian and tropical plants, including a Japanese garden with traditional lantern pagodas and a striking bamboo collection. Visitors can explore a wetland area, water garden with cascading oolite fountain, and an array of flowering trees, palms, cycads, and orchids. The garden also hosts various events like weekend yoga and meditation sessions.
name: Miami Beach Botanical Garden
address: 2000 Convention Ctr Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Famous coastal street that passes by many historical Art Deco hotels, bars & restaurants.
detail_description: Ocean Drive is a renowned coastal street located in the heart of South Beach, Miami. It is home to over 900 Art Deco and 1930s/50s-style buildings, including iconic landmarks like the Colony Hotel. The area offers a unique Miami experience with its historical architecture, upscale hotels, vibrant nightlife, and trendy restaurants. Visitors can enjoy people-watching, take photos, and soak up the lively atmosphere of Miami.
name: Ocean Dr
address: Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Sandy spot with beach access, plus a playground for young children & fitness equipment.
detail_description: Lummus Park is a vibrant and iconic spot in Miami, offering a mix of beach activities, outdoor fitness options, and family-friendly amenities. The park spans 74 acres and features a beachfront path that showcases South Beach's famous landmarks and architecture. Visitors can enjoy various activities such as swimming, biking, roller skating, and working out with the outdoor gym equipment. Additionally, the park hosts pop-up markets and art shows like Scope Miami Beach.
name: Lummus Park
address: 1130 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Miami Beach is a south Florida island city, connected by bridges to mainland Miami. Wide beaches stretch from North Shore Open Space Park, past palm-lined Lummus Park to South Pointe Park. The southern end, South Beach, is known for its international cachet with models and celebrities, and its early-20th-century architecture in the Art Deco Historic district with pastel-colored buildings, especially on Ocean Drive.
detail_description: Miami Beach is a vibrant island city in southern Florida, connected to mainland Miami by bridges. The area boasts wide beaches that extend from North Shore Open Space Park to South Pointe Park, with the famous South Beach at its southern end. This part of the beach is renowned for its international allure, attracting models and celebrities. Additionally, the Art Deco Historic District showcases stunning pastel-colored buildings from the early 20th century along Ocean Drive.
name: Miami Beach
address: Florida, USA

excerpt: Historic art deco space featuring diverse art, artifacts & sculpture garden, plus films & lectures.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant Collins Park, just a stone's throw from the beach, The Bass stands as a beacon of contemporary art in Miami Beach. This historic art deco gem, once the Miami Beach Public Library and Art Center, showcases an impressive array of international contemporary artworks across various media including sculpture, design, fashion, and architecture. Visitors can explore its two floors filled with rotating exhibitions that keep the experience fresh and engaging.
name: The Bass
address: 2100 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Historic estate with formal gardens & sculptures, grottos & circa-1914 mansion turned museum.
detail_description: Vizcaya Museum & Gardens is a historic estate located in Coconut Grove, Miami. Built between 1914 and 1922, it was the waterfront villa of James Deering, an art collector and conservationist. The museum houses a diverse collection of furniture, tapestries, sculptures, and paintings from the early 20th century.
name: Vizcaya Museum & Gardens
address: 3251 S Miami Ave, Miami, FL 33129, USA

excerpt: Self-guided tours at an outdoor Holocaust museum with a memorial wall & a huge human hand sculpture.
detail_description: The Holocaust Memorial Miami Beach serves as a profound tribute to the millions of Jewish lives lost during World War II. Designed by artist-architect Kenneth Treister, this outdoor museum features an impressive array of over 100 sculptures, with the centerpiece being the Sculpture of Love and Anguish—a striking bronze arm reaching skyward, symbolizing both despair and hope.
name: Holocaust Memorial Miami Beach
address: 1933-1945 Meridian Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Unique outdoor destination featuring huge, colorful street murals by artists from around the globe.
detail_description: Wynwood Walls is a vibrant outdoor destination showcasing large, colorful street murals created by artists from all over the world. Spanning between Northeast 25th and 26th Streets on Northwest 2nd Avenue, this innovative enclave features modern urban artwork that represents a diverse range of graffiti and street art styles. Over 50 renowned and emerging artists have converted 80,000 square feet of warehouse walls into an open-air museum, making it a must-see spot for photography enthusiasts.
name: Wynwood Walls
address: 2516 NW 2nd Ave, Miami, FL 33127, USA

excerpt: Famed the world over for its Art Deco, this area of Miami is the epicenter for architecture fans.
detail_description: The Art Deco Welcome Center is a must-visit for architecture enthusiasts in Miami. Situated in the vibrant South Beach neighborhood, this iconic area boasts over 800 historic buildings with the distinctive Art Deco style of the 1920s and 1930s. The center provides information on tours and opportunities to explore the colorful streets, galleries, shops, and restaurants that define this energetic district.
name: Art Deco Welcome Center
address: 1001 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Waterfront park with beach/pier access, a playground & splash pad, plus walking/biking & open space.
detail_description: South Pointe Park is a beautiful waterfront park located in the upscale South of Fifth neighborhood at the southernmost tip of South Beach. It offers beach and pier access, a playground with interactive water features, and a dog park for off-leash fun. Visitors can enjoy stunning views of Biscayne Bay meeting the Atlantic Ocean, as well as the downtown Miami skyline and Fisher Island. The park also features walking paths, picnic areas, barbecue pits, and a mini splash zone for kids.
name: South Pointe Park
address: 1 Washington Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: $25 million complex for kids with hands-on exhibits, classes, a cruise ship replica & music studio.
detail_description: Nestled on a charming island between downtown Miami and the vibrant South Beach, the Miami Children's Museum is a $25 million wonderland designed specifically for young explorers. This engaging complex features an array of hands-on exhibits that captivate children's imaginations while providing valuable learning experiences. From a giant piggy bank that introduces financial literacy to the enchanting Castle of Dreams—a two-story sand castle complete with a winding slide—there's no shortage of fun here.
name: Miami Children's Museum
address: 980 MacArthur Cswy, Miami, FL 33132, USA

detail_description: Lincoln Rd in Miami Beach has become a hub for innovative open-air theater productions, offering a unique and safe way to enjoy live performances. The area's history as the 'Fifth Avenue of the South' is evident in its transformation from a swampy dirt road to a bustling shopping destination. Visitors can soak up the vibrant atmosphere by relaxing on Ocean Drive or dining at outdoor establishments while taking in the lively street scene.
name: Lincoln Rd
address: Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: More low-key than lively South Beach, North Beach is a mellow residential area fringed by a wide stretch of sand. Midcentury hotels line Collins Avenue, backed by Miami Modern-style apartment buildings. Locals attend concerts at the historic North Beach Bandshell or enjoy North Shore Open Space Park, with its trails and native trees. Casual global dining includes Argentinean fare in Little Buenos Aires.
detail_description: North Beach, a serene residential area in Miami Beach, offers a laid-back atmosphere and a wide sandy coastline. The neighborhood features midcentury hotels along Collins Avenue and Miami Modern-style apartment buildings. Residents can enjoy live music at the historic North Beach Bandshell or explore the trails and native trees at North Shore Open Space Park. Additionally, the area boasts diverse dining options, including Argentinean cuisine in Little Buenos Aires.
name: North Beach
address: Miami Beach, FL 33141, USA

excerpt: Sizable X-rated museum showcasing over 4,000 pieces of fine erotic art from 300 BC to the present.
detail_description: The World Erotic Art Museum (WEAM) in Miami Beach is a unique and sizable museum that showcases over 4,000 pieces of fine erotic art dating back to 300 BC. Established in 2005 by art collector Naomi Wilzig, the museum offers a comprehensive exploration of human sexuality through various cultures and artistic styles such as surrealism, realism, and art deco.
name: World Erotic Art Museum
address: 1205 Washington Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Hands-on facility offering weather & technology exhibits, a planetarium & an aquarium.
detail_description: The Phillip & Patricia Frost Museum of Science, also known as Frost Science, is a captivating facility in Miami that offers interactive exhibits on weather, technology, and the natural world. With a three-level aquarium featuring sharks and stingrays, a dome-screened planetarium, and hands-on activities for kids of all ages, it's both entertaining and educational. The museum is located in Museum Park alongside other attractions like the Perez Art Museum and the Dogs and Cats Walkway and Sculpture Gardens.
name: Phillip & Patricia Frost Museum of Science
address: 1101 Biscayne Blvd, Miami, FL 33132, USA

excerpt: Cavernous, bustling space drawing crowds for crab, Key lime pie & more.
detail_description: Joe's Stone Crab is a bustling and cavernous restaurant in Miami that has been serving delicious seafood for over a century. The place is famous for its stone crabs, which have become a local delicacy and a must-try for seafood enthusiasts visiting the city. The New England clam chowder and Old Bay fries are also highly recommended. While some find the seasoning to be on the milder side, the attentive service from tuxedo-wearing waiters adds to the overall dining experience.
name: Joe's Stone Crab
address: 11 Washington Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Large waterside shopping center with many familiar stores, plus take-out & sit-down restaurants.
detail_description: Bayside Marketplace is a vibrant waterfront shopping center located in downtown Miami, offering a diverse mix of familiar retail stores, local artisan stalls, and unique tourist shops. This two-level outdoor plaza features over 150 shops, including popular national retailers like Guess, GAP, and Victoria's Secret. Visitors can also explore an international food court and enjoy impeccable international cuisine while taking in stunning waterfront views of Biscayne Bay.
name: Bayside Marketplace
address: 401 Biscayne Blvd, Miami, FL 33132, USA

excerpt: Miami is a coastal city in the U.S. state of Florida and the county seat of Miami-Dade County in South Florida. It is the core of the Miami metropolitan area, which, with a population of 6.14 million, is the second-largest metropolitan area in the Southeast after Atlanta, and the ninth-largest in the United States. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Miami, known as the City of Miami, is a vibrant coastal city in Florida. It offers a variety of activities for visitors to enjoy, such as dolphin and birding tours on Marco Island, thrilling airboat rides in the Everglades National Park, and wildlife shows.
name: Miami
address: Florida, USA

excerpt: Esteemed orchestral academy & symphony occupying a space & concert hall designed by Frank Gehry.
detail_description: The New World Center, located in the heart of Miami Beach, is a stunning concert hall and home to the prestigious New World Symphony. Designed by renowned architect Frank Gehry, this modern architectural gem features an 80-foot-high glass curtain wall and hosts a variety of concerts and ballet performances throughout the season.
name: New World Center
address: 500 17th St, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Sleek waterfront museum features modern & contemporary international artwork & educational programs.
detail_description: Pérez Art Museum Miami (PAMM) is a leading art museum located in the Downtown Arts District near Edgewater and Wynwood. The museum's striking architecture, designed by Herzog & de Meuron, offers a unique experience with its vertical gardens suspended from the canopy's overhang. Inspired by the Stiltsville homes of the 1930s, PAMM overlooks Biscayne Bay and features a permanent collection of modern and contemporary international artwork.
name: Pérez Art Museum Miami
address: 1103 Biscayne Blvd, Miami, FL 33132, USA

excerpt: Home to nearly 3,000 animal, bird & plant species, this destination boasts a petting zoo & trails.
detail_description: Jungle Island is a tropical island theme park located on the MacArthur Causeway, offering an interactive experience with over 3,000 exotic animals and 500 plant species. Families can enjoy animal stage shows, aviaries, jungle trails, a petting farm, and educational exhibits. The park also features world-famous parrot shows, a Serpentarium, Jungle Theater, and an Everglades Habitat.
name: Jungle Island
address: 1111 Parrot Jungle Trail, Miami, FL 33132, USA

excerpt: Jewish life in Florida & Latin America recorded in photos & artifacts, housed in a former synagogue.
detail_description: The Jewish Museum of Florida-FIU, located just a short stroll away from the lively South Beach, offers a unique perspective on the local culture by delving into the stories of Jewish immigrants and their influence on shaping modern Miami and Florida. Housed in two former synagogues and part of Florida International University, this museum boasts an extensive collection of over 100,000 items that document more than 250 years of Florida's Jewish history and culture.
name: Jewish Museum of Florida-FIU
address: 301 Washington Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

detail_description: Española Way is a delightful pedestrian area located in Miami Beach, featuring stunning Spanish colonial architecture and Mediterranean Revival style. This picturesque village offers open-air streets lined with charming restaurants and cafes, perfect for leisurely strolls, people-watching, or enjoying a cup of coffee or glass of wine. The area's romantic ambiance is enhanced by twinkling cafe lights at night.
name: Española Way
address: 405 Española Wy, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Eclectic industrial design collection in a 1927 building, plus lectures, films & arts events.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of South Beach's Art Deco Historic District, The Wolfsonian-Florida International University stands as a captivating museum and research center within a stunning 1920s Mediterranean Revival building. This eclectic venue showcases an impressive collection of over 200,000 artifacts that span from 1850 to 1950, highlighting the profound influence of art and design on global history.
name: The Wolfsonian-Florida International University
address: 1001 Washington Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Paintings, sculpture & multi-media installations showcased in an ultramodern venue with a garden.
detail_description: The Institute of Contemporary Art in Miami is a modern venue showcasing paintings, sculpture, and multi-media installations. It houses an impressive collection committed to advancing 20th and 21st-century art. The three-story building features rotating exhibitions and an outdoor sculpture garden. What sets the ICA apart is its free admission and public programs including lectures, symposiums, film screenings, and educational youth programs.
name: Institute of Contemporary Art, Miami
address: 61 NE 41st St, Miami, FL 33137, USA

excerpt: Brickell is the city's financial center, where glittering business towers and luxury condos tower over Biscayne Bay. Rooftop bars and surf 'n' turf grills cater to the banking and business crowd, while the art galleries and fashionable boutiques in the Brickell City Centre attract chic locals. The Brickell Avenue Bridge spans the Miami River and has views of the waterfront Miami Circle park and archaeological site.
detail_description: Brickell, located in Miami, is a bustling financial center with towering business buildings and upscale residential complexes overlooking Biscayne Bay. The area offers a vibrant mix of rooftop bars, high-end dining options, art galleries, and trendy boutiques at the Brickell City Centre. The neighborhood is also known for its proximity to the Miami River and the scenic Brickell Avenue Bridge. Visitors can explore the waterfront Miami Circle park and archaeological site while taking in stunning views.
name: Brickell
address: Miami, FL, USA

excerpt: Modern, landscaped park offering outdoor movie events with high-tech audio & visual effects.
detail_description: Soundscape Park is a modern, landscaped 2.5-acre oasis in Miami that offers a variety of cultural experiences. The park features towering palm trees, well-manicured lawns, and unique art installations. Visitors can enjoy outdoor movie events with high-tech audio and visual effects or attend world-class concerts at the New World Center. The park serves as an urban retreat with open green spaces and walkways designed to provide a soothing experience for tourists seeking relaxation.
name: Soundscape Park
address: 400 17th St, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

detail_description: Miami Beach Boardwalk is a picturesque and vibrant three-mile stretch along the coast of Miami Beach, offering stunning views and access to the city's most beautiful beaches. Starting at Indian Beach Park in Mid-Beach Miami and extending to South Beach, this oceanfront pedestrian promenade is perfect for walking, jogging, rollerblading, or cycling. The well-lit boardwalk provides a safe and scenic environment for evening strolls while also being great for people-watching.
name: Miami Beach Boardwalk
address: Miami Beach, FL 33140, USA

excerpt: Popular island park with protected beach, tennis & amusement centers, eco-tours & concessions.
detail_description: Crandon Park, situated on Key Biscayne, is a popular island park featuring a protected beach and various recreational facilities. The park's Crandon Park Beach offers crystal-clear waters and an offshore sandbar for sunbathing. Visitors can enjoy eco-tours, picnic areas, and concession stands. Additionally, the Family Amusement Center features a restored carousel and beachfront playground.
name: Crandon Park
address: 6747 Crandon Blvd, Key Biscayne, FL 33149, USA

excerpt: Laid-back ambiance, rustic decor, pool tables & jukebox make this SoBe institution a local hangout.
detail_description: Mac's Club Deuce, established in 1926, is a legendary dive bar and a local hangout in South Beach. It has a laid-back ambiance with rustic decor, pool tables, and a jukebox. The late celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain was fond of this smoke-filled spot that stands out in South Beach for its eclectic mix of patrons. The bar offers a daily two-for-one happy hour from 8 am to 7 pm and is open until 5 am.
name: Mac's Club Deuce
address: 222 14th St, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Luxury condo buildings and upscale MiMo (Miami Modern) hotels line the shores of Miami’s trendy Mid-Beach area. The 1954 Fontainebleau Miami Beach, once a Rat Pack playground, is notable for its striking curved lines. Stylish bars and sophisticated eateries with high-profile chefs cater to a chic crowd. The Faena District is a 3-block complex with an arts center designed by Rem Koolhaas, and a retail bazaar.
detail_description: Mid-Beach, located between South Beach and North Beach in Miami, is a trendy area known for its luxury condo buildings and upscale MiMo hotels. The iconic Fontainebleau Miami Beach, once a hotspot for the Rat Pack, stands out with its distinctive curved architecture. This chic neighborhood offers stylish bars, sophisticated eateries with renowned chefs, and the Faena District's 3-block complex featuring an arts center designed by Rem Koolhaas and a retail bazaar.
name: Mid-Beach
address: Miami Beach, FL, USA

detail_description: Lincoln Road Mall is a must-visit destination, especially if you're exploring with your furry friend. This pedestrian-friendly mall, located just a few blocks from the beach, offers over 200 shops, retail stores, boutiques, and art galleries. Many of these establishments are pet-friendly, making it an ideal place to stroll with your dog. The mall also features abundant greenery and outdoor dining areas for a pleasant shopping experience.
name: Lincoln Road Mall
address: 530 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

detail_description: Ocean Drive stands out as the heart of South Beach, offering an enchanting experience for those who enjoy leisurely strolls. Recently transformed into a car-free zone, this vibrant thoroughfare invites visitors to explore its lively atmosphere without the distraction of traffic. As you wander along Ocean Drive, you'll be captivated by the stunning architecture that defines the Art Deco District. It's a fantastic spot for capturing memorable photos and soaking in the energetic nightlife that makes this area so special.
name: Art Deco District y Ocean Drive
address: 1020 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: The Design District is known for its sleek modern architecture, upscale interior design stores and art galleries. Luxury fashion and jewelry boutiques, cafes and celebrity-chef restaurants draw a well-heeled crowd. Public art dotting the area includes the Fly’s Eye Dome, a geodesic dome designed by inventor Buckminster Fuller. The Institute of Contemporary Art shows cutting-edge work in an ultra-modern building.
detail_description: Miami Design District is a hub of sleek modern architecture, upscale interior design stores, and art galleries. It's home to luxury fashion boutiques, jewelry stores, cafes, and celebrity-chef restaurants that attract a stylish crowd. The area features public art installations like the Fly’s Eye Dome by inventor Buckminster Fuller and the Institute of Contemporary Art showcasing cutting-edge work in an ultra-modern building.
name: Miami Design District
address: Miami, FL, USA

excerpt: Waterfront city green space with a popular amphitheater, landmark fountain & many community events.
detail_description: Bayfront Park is a vibrant waterfront green space in the city, featuring an iconic amphitheater and a landmark fountain. The park hosts numerous community events and offers various attractions, including the renowned Bayside Marketplace with its diverse range of vendors and dining options. Visitors can explore memorials dedicated to historical figures and enjoy free outdoor yoga classes by the bay. The park spans 32 acres of lush landscapes, complete with a small beach, tropical rock garden, and waterfall dating back to 1926.
name: Bayfront Park
address: 301 Biscayne Blvd, Miami, FL 33132, USA

excerpt: Lively complex hosting shows, sealife displays & kids' playground, plus dolphin rides & experiences.
detail_description: Miami Seaquarium, located on Virginia Key, is a must-visit for families with kids. Since 1955, this marine complex has been captivating visitors with its diverse sea life displays and entertaining shows featuring killer whales, dolphins, manatees, penguins, sea turtles, and sharks. The 750,000-gallon saltwater aquarium is home to many of these friendly creatures. Additionally, the Seaquarium offers dolphin rides and experiences for an up-close encounter with these intelligent mammals.
name: Miami Seaquarium
address: 4400, Rickenbacker Cswy, Miami, FL 33149, USA

excerpt: Education center with archives, exhibits & area tours exploring Miami's multicultural history.
detail_description: HistoryMiami Museum, a Smithsonian affiliate, is an educational center that delves into Miami's diverse history through archives, exhibits, and area tours. Established in 1940, it is the largest history museum in Florida and features four permanent galleries along with rotating exhibits. The museum also houses an Archives and Research Center, the South Florida Folklife Center, and offers City Tours.
name: HistoryMiami Museum
address: 101 W Flagler St, Miami, FL 33130, USA

excerpt: Classic & unique cocktails are paired with American bites like lobster rolls at this hip haunt.
detail_description: Sweet Liberty Drinks & Supply Company is a trendy spot in Miami Beach that perfectly captures the city's cultural diversity and classic American diner charm. It offers a mix of upscale food, innovative cocktails, and old favorites, making it a hit with everyone. The menu features a fusion of American and international flavors, including deviled eggs, pimento cheese, Mexican elote, Hawaiian poke, and more. With its expertly crafted cocktails and convivial atmosphere, Sweet Liberty is popular among both locals and tourists.
name: Sweet Liberty Drinks & Supply Company
address: 237 20th St suite b, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Compact, romantic watering hole in the Freehand Hostel offering inventive drinks & a large backyard.
detail_description: Nestled within the Freehand Hostel, Broken Shaker at Freehand Miami is a charming and intimate bar that has evolved from a pop-up to one of Miami's, New York City's, and Los Angeles' most beloved cocktail spots. Created by Bar Lab's Gabriel Orta and Elad Zvi, this award-winning bar boasts a large backyard with twinkling lights and mismatched patio furniture where guests can savor innovative drinks.
name: Broken Shaker
address: 2727 Indian Creek Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33140, USA

excerpt: Downtown Miami is a busy shopping area with cultural and event venues. During the day, the open-air malls, department stores and jewelry shops are busy with foot traffic, while at night, crowds descend on the American Airlines Arena for Miami Heat basketball games and big-name concerts. The Adrienne Arsht Center hosts the Miami City Ballet and Florida Grand Opera, and the Pérez Art Museum Miami shows contemporary art.
detail_description: Downtown Miami is a bustling area known for its shopping, cultural attractions, and entertainment venues. During the day, visitors can explore open-air malls, department stores, and jewelry shops. At night, the American Airlines Arena draws crowds for Miami Heat basketball games and concerts. The Adrienne Arsht Center hosts performances by the Miami City Ballet and Florida Grand Opera, while the Pérez Art Museum Miami showcases contemporary art.
name: Downtown Miami
address: Miami, FL, USA

excerpt: Long-running gay fixture known for weekend drag shows, plus all-day breakfast & bar-food menu.
detail_description: Palace Bar & Restaurant is a long-standing gay establishment in the heart of Miami's Art Deco District. It's renowned for its vibrant drag shows, which happen every evening and during Sunday brunch. The place exudes queer joy, with dynamic performances that spill onto the street and attract big crowds. The bar offers a full food menu with Latin flavors and American favorites, along with refreshing cocktails like the blueberry mojito and Chandon Garden Spritz.
name: Palace Bar & Restaurant
address: 1052 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: Trendy, opulent Fontainebleau Hotel club where DJs spin at parties that attract celebs & VIPs.
detail_description: LIV is a renowned nightclub located in the Fontainebleau Hotel in Miami Beach, known for its opulent and trendy atmosphere. The club has gained worldwide fame and is a magnet for music enthusiasts and partygoers. With an impressive 18,000 square feet of space, it features various areas for lounging and dancing, a state-of-the-art sound system, stunning lighting equipment, and VIP amenities.
name: LIV Nightclub Miami
address: 4441 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140, USA

excerpt: Running parallel to the beach, this celebrated road features shopping, famous hotels & restaurants.
detail_description: Collins Ave is a renowned road that runs alongside the beach in Miami Beach, offering an array of shopping options, famous hotels, and restaurants. During the postwar era, it played a pivotal role in Miami Beach's rise to prominence as tourists flocked to luxurious hotels like Sagamore, Sans Souci, and Saxony. The avenue is lined with palm trees and exudes opulence just a block away from Ocean Drive. Named after John S.
name: Collins Ave
address: Florida, USA

excerpt: 36-acre park including an 8-lane lap swimming pool plus playground, baseball stadium & soccer field.
detail_description: Flamingo Park is a 36-acre recreational area in South Beach, offering a variety of activities for visitors of all ages. The park features an 8-lane lap swimming pool, playgrounds, baseball stadium, and soccer field. Families can enjoy the aquatic play area and tire swings while kids splash around in the pools. Sports enthusiasts will appreciate the basketball and tennis courts, football field, soccer field, running track, and fitness equipment available at the park.
name: Flamingo Park
address: 11th Street, Jefferson Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

excerpt: An oceanfront beach lined with shops, a botanic garden & entertainment venues, such as the ballet.
detail_description: Collins Park is a vibrant oceanfront destination located in an up-and-coming area alongside the Bass Art Museum. Visitors can explore a variety of attractions, including shops, a botanic garden, and entertainment venues such as the ballet. The park also offers opportunities for artistic expression through camps and activities at the Creativity Center. Additionally, art enthusiasts can immerse themselves in contemporary works at The Bass, featuring pieces from around the world and hosting engaging speaker series.
name: Collins Park
address: 2100 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140, USA

detail_description: The ROMERO BRITTO Fine Art Gallery is a vibrant hub of creativity located on Lincoln Road, where the spirit of Brazilian pop artist Romero Britto comes to life. Known for his joyful and colorful artwork that draws inspiration from masters like Matisse and Picasso, Britto's pieces are designed to evoke happiness and positivity. Visitors can explore an array of unique items including prints, sculptures, tote bags, dishes, and puzzles adorned with his signature style.
name: ROMERO BRITTO Fine Art Gallery
address: 1102 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

detail_description: LIK Fine Art Miami is a must-visit gallery for art enthusiasts and photography lovers. The stunning cityscapes and landscapes on display are masterfully captured, offering a unique perspective on iconic landmarks. Visitors praise the attentive and accommodating staff who provide excellent service. The gallery showcases breathtaking work by renowned photographer Peter Lik, making it a top destination in South Beach for those seeking high-quality art. While some may find the artwork pricey, many agree that the exceptional quality justifies the cost.
name: LIK Fine Art
address: 655 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA

detail_description: Faena Theater in Miami is a lavish cabaret-style venue that evokes the grandeur of Europe's opera houses while exuding a decadent and sumptuous Miami vibe. The theater hosts an original live production called Trysta Lovers' Rendezvous, featuring elements of circus and burlesque, set amidst red velvet surroundings and a magnificent crystal chandelier. Renowned artists like Bon Jovi, Macy Gray, and Andra Day have graced the intimate stage with captivating performances.
name: Faena Theater
address: 3201 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33140, USA

excerpt: Bustling thoroughfare lined with shops, nightclubs & art deco hotels, plus beachfront parks.
detail_description: North Beach Oceanside Park is a serene and spacious 28-acre park located in Miami Beach, stretching along Collins Avenue from 78th Street to 87th Street. It offers a leash-free dog run, children's playground, picnic tables, barbecue areas, and party pavilions for special events. This beachfront park provides a tranquil atmosphere with sea grape trees offering natural shade and plenty of space for families to gather.
name: North Beach Oceanside Park
address: 8328 Collins Ave, Miami Beach, FL 33141, USA
